key_risks: Labor disputes leading to operational shutdowns and revenue loss
Regulatory and legal challenges increasing operational costs
Competitive pressures from other Class I railroads
controversies: 2024 Canada railway dispute causing cargo backlogs and reputational damage
Failed acquisition of Kansas City Southern (KCS) in 2021
environmental_issues: Criticism for transporting fossil fuels despite sustainability commitments
social_issues: Significant labor challenges including strikes and union disputes
governance_issues: Potential for regulatory interventions disrupting operations

sources.title: Canadian National Railway (CN) - The Canadian Encyclopedia
sources.snippet: Canadian National Railway Company, incorporated 6 June 1919, is the longest railway system in North America, controlling more than 31,000 km of track in Canada and the United States. It is the only transcontinental rail network in North America, connecting to three coasts: Atlantic, Pacific and Gulf of Mexico.

sources.title: 2024 Canada railway dispute - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: The 2024 Canada railway dispute was a labour-business dispute between the Canadian National Railway Company (CN) and Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) and the Teamsters Canada Rail Conference that shut down the freight railway operations of both railway companies. The shutdown also included passenger trains operating on CPKC tracks, but not passenger trains running on CN tracks.
